main event: On June 21, 1956, a radar observed an unidentified object in Cincinnati, Ohio for 9 seconds. Radar analysis suggests ground clutter as the probable cause.
interesting points: The observation was made by two meteorologists and an electronics engineer.
The object appeared as an echo on the radar scope and had moved about 4 to 5 miles within 6 seconds.
The report indicates that the object's reflective area scattered and faded as it disappeared from view.
The witness was a 31-year-old male staff meteorologist with college education in physics, math, and postgraduate meteorology.
The report sought detailed information including the observer's location, time of day, weather conditions, and additional witnesses.
